did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: George Mason University. Special Collections and Archives.

did.abstract: This collection contains two original film scripts of "Colossus" by James Bridges, (Revised Final Screenplay, October 8, 1968) and "Freud" by John Huston and Wolfgang Reinhardt (Final Shooting Script, February 10, 1962) and two scrapbooks representing artistic design research compiled by Hecht-Hill-Lancaster for Universal Studios' 1957 film production of George B. Shaw's "The Devil's Disciple."

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: There are no restrictions on personal use. Permission to publish material from the Cynthia Garn film production collection must be obtained from the Special Collections Research Center, George Mason University Libraries.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Cynthia Garn film production collection, C0009, Special Collections and Archives, George Mason University Libraries.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Collection donated by Cynthia Garn in 1989.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Special Collections and Archives staff. EAD markup completed by Eron Ackerman and Jordan Patty in April 2009.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: Cynthia Garn's father, A. Golitzen, was an artistic designer who worked on many of Universal City Studios' productions. These materials originally belonged to Golitzen and were titled over to Cynthia Garn, his daughter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection contains two original film scripts of "Colossus" by James Bridges, (Revised Final Screenplay, October 8, 1968) and "Freud" by John Huston and Wolfgang Reinhardt (Final Shooting Script, February 10, 1962) and two scrapbooks representing artistic design research compiled by Hecht-Hill-Lancaster for Universal Studios' 1957 film production of George B. Shaw's "The Devil's Disciple."

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Special Collections and Archives also holds the Motion picture press kits collection.
